result.execSummary:
The defendant Emma D Beighley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business tomorrow. 
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
Def to have NO Contact w/ Walmart Store in Ashland, WI. 
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.

Complete Moral Recognition Therapy as directed by the DOC. 
The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC.
Undergo a Substance Abuse Assmt & comply with all treatment recommendations.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
Financial obligations to be paid through the county

timeConds.notes: To commence after any other period of confinement

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emma D Beighley

records.addlTxt: 2:41 PM Defendant Emma D Beighley appeared by video, in custody from Oneida County Jail.  Attorney Marcus M Zimmer appeared by video for Emma D Beighley.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  File contains PLQ.  Parties have agreement.  No restitution.  State has complied with victim rights.  Def is waiving right to personal appearance.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts the waiver.  File contains WOPH, signed 10/7/22.  Def waiving right to prelim hearing.  Atty satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Court has reviewed complaint and finds PC that a felony was committed in Ashland County, case is bound over for arraignment.  State is filing information now.  Def understands charges and potential penalties.  Atty, def pleads NO CONTEST, def agrees.  File contains PLQ, def understands information, rights giving up, and elements.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts NO CONTEST pleas.  As a factual basis can court rely on the information in the complaint, parties agree.  Court finds a factual basis exists and finds def GUILTY, and direct judgment to enter.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments on sentencing.  Def makes a statement.  See attached for sentencing.
email sent to Oneida county advising def has court on Oct 10;  ka
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Email sent to Oneida Co advising def has court on Oct 13;  ka

9:52 AM Defendant Emma D Beighley appeared by video, in custody from Oneida County.  Attorney Marcus M Zimmer in court for Emma D Beighley.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty, def has received a copy of complaint, waives reading, requests prelim hearing within statutory time limits.  If def is in custody, Atty needs to let jail know so they can transport.  Can zoom if out of custody, needs stipulation regarding identification.  Motion to modify bail,  State opposes.  Atty, comments on motion.  Court is satisfied, motion is denied.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
